bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, July 23, 1875

div1.p: Reed writes that he misses her.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, July 23, 1875
div1.p:
I arrived here
just a moment ago, & as Thorn
ton kindly offers to be the bea-
rer of a message to you, how
cant I withold my willing
hand? Truly, my darling, I never
knew how much I loved you, till
our to-day's separation. Heav-
en knows I would give 5 years
of my life to be permitted to
return &, seated in the old
arm-chair, to look once
more into your dear sweet
face! I should be sad, in-
deed, at our parting, did I
not feel that it was nec-
essary for a while; but
bye & bye, should a kind
Providence favor me, I
will return, nor leave alone-
May that day quickly come!

I would write more, but
I have but little time &
must drop a letter to Ma,
informing her of my ap-
pointment- Received a letter
from her to-day -- she sent
very much love to you-

Good-bye, my own dar-
ling E. & may God preserve
& keep you alway, is
the prayer & earnest
wish of your
div1.closer:
Fond & devoted Walter.
P.S.
Please excuse all shortcomings
of pen & paper, as I write
in great haste -- will write
again to-night.
W.
